revisionDesc.change: added temporary customization of tei:m to allow model.hiLike content
temporarily reversed omission of "accMat additions catchwords heraldry secFol signatures stamp watermark" (from msdescription), and "metamark retrace" (from transcr)
removing customization of altIdentifier (see 2014-02-10) now fixed in TEI
stopped omitting "charProp localName mapping unicodeName value" from gaiji (requested by IOSPE)
omitted "accMat additions catchwords heraldry secFol signatures stamp watermark" (from msdescription), "appInfo" (from header), and "metamark retrace" (from transcr).
fixed TEI errors in ODD (msdescription; unclear -> core; datatype in lb/@break)
stopped omitting fw from trancr (as per https://sourceforge.net/p/epidoc/feature-requests/67/)
stopped omitting s from Analysis (requested by Perseus)
stopped omitting charDecl, glyph, glyphName from Gaiji (requested by DASI), and phr from Analysis (requested by Coptic Scriptorium)
stopped omitting variantEncoding from textcrit module (as per request from IGLouvre)
temporarily adding att.global to altIdentifier (to fix problem with TEI 2.6.0)
added the value 'stacked' in hi @rend
stopped omitting anchor from the linking module
removed temp customization of space (fixed in TEI 2.3.0)
suppressed schematron constraint on att.datable.custom
improved schematron constraints for gap, date; added constraints for space
stopped omitting birth and death
change TEI namespace to tei: to match Schematron declaration
added comments explaining ODD customizations below
temporarily added certLike to space to patch a TEI bug
removed customization of person and place, now catered for by TEI 2.2.0
added schematron constraints for @when-custom, abbreviations, and gaps added corpus model (but omitted everything except particDesc and settingDesc)
removed description/history/figure and underline-supraline, following deprecation 2 years ago
switched to using @except on moduleRef instead of @mode="delete" on elementSpec
Stopped omitting damage
Added spoken module; deleted all elements from that module
stopped omitting relation
stopped omitting floruit and state
stopped omitting join; added idno to content of person and place
added "inverted" and "small" to suggested values for hi[@rend]
removed customization of provenance, origPlace, msItem
stop omitting location
added att.responsibility to provenance (temporary fix)
removed modification of lb/@type and added vocab control for lb/@break
added att.typed to provenance and origPlace (temporary fix)
added type to origPlace (temporary fix); made msItem/@class repeatable (temporary fix)
stop omitting tags: bloc, country, district, rdgGrp
stopped excluding tei:offset
deprecated description and history; changed values of @evidence
deprecated hi/@rend='supraline-underline'
made hi/@rend optional, repeatable (x5)
added xincludes for 3 example components in guidelines
stopped omitting event and listEvent
tweaked some descriptions; reversed high and low
created new valList for @unit; added valList for @extent
undid deleted analysis elements: interp, interpGrp
changed 'worddiv' to 'inWord'
stop omitting few tags: orgName element
removed dummy 'precision' element
Created bare ODD from Roma

body.p: EpiDoc TEI Customization starts with modules tei, core, textstructure and header. Customization for the Papyri Charter Project (Cologne).

moduleRef.except: argument byline closer div1 div2 div3 div4 div5 div6 div7 imprimatur opener postscript salute signed titlePage titlePart trailer
affiliation age climate education faith geoFeat langKnowledge langKnown nameLink nationality occupation population relationGrp residence sex socecStatus terrain trait
lacunaEnd lacunaStart listWit witDetail witEnd witStart witness
broadcast equipment incident kinesic pause recording recordingStmt scriptStmt shift u vocal writing
activity channel constitution derivation domain factuality interaction locale preparedness purpose setting textDesc

valItem.desc: to contain apparatus criticus or textual notes
to contain bibliographical information, previous publications, etc.
to contain all editorial commentary, historical/prosopographical discussion, etc.
to contain the text of the edition itself; may include multiple text-parts
used to divide a div[type=edition] into multiple parts (fragments, columns, faces, etc.)
to contain a translation of the text into one or more modern languages

sch:rule.sch:report: ex should only appear inside expan
ex should not be a child of abbr
gap may have @quantity (a figure) or @extent (a descriptive text value) but not both
If gap has @quantity then @unit is required
gap may not appear within supplied text

valItem.desc: Text completely lost from the surface and unrecoverable
Traces of text remains on the surface but cannot be interpreted
Text erroneously omitted from the surface by the scribe/cutter
Text omitted from the edition by the editor, for whatever reason (brevity, context, language, etc.)
ancient acute (oxia, tonos) diacritic
ancient asper (rough breathing) diacritic
ancient circumflex (perispomeni) diacritic
ancient diaeresis
ancient grave (varia) diacritic
characters scored or struck through at the mid-line level
character(s) inverted or rotated with respect to the rest of the text
ancient lenis (smooth breathing) diacritic
two (or more) letters ligatured, monogrammed, or therwise joined
characters reversed (backward-facing) with respect to the rest of the line of text
Letter(s) smaller than those around them
characters written lower than the surrounding text
characters written higher than the surrounding text
characters written with a supralinear line above (e.g. for abbreviation or numerals)
Letter(s) taller than those around it, e.g. I-longa
text written with solid line beneath
a character written directly above another character (as opposed to superscript)

elementSpec.desc: marks the start of each line of the transcribed text, including the first

valItem.desc: this line-beginning should not be taken as a word-break, i.e. word would be hyphenated in a printed text
Text dated palaeographically
Text dated by nomenclature or onomastics
Text dated by known persons named or implied within it
Text dated by the reign of an emperor or other ruler
Text dated by the use of official titles
Text dated by explicit internal date
Archaeological, epigraphic, iconographic or other context of the text support

sch:rule.sch:report: space may have @quantity (a figure) or @extent (a descriptive text value) but not both
If space has @quantity then @unit is required

valItem.desc: Characters supplied from a parallel version of this text, absent from this one
Characters visible to a previous editor, now lost/unclear due to damage
Restoration of text completely lost from the surface
Supplement of text erroneously omitted from the surface by the scribe/cutter
Editorial supplement of words subaudible to the native reader
Editorial explanation of oblique text in original
Text restored (e.g. from earlier witness or alternate copy) without specification of current state of this text

rng:attribute.name: mainLang
rng:attribute.a:documentation: (main language) supplies a code which identifies the chief language used in the bibliographic work.

rng:attribute.name: otherLangs
rng:attribute.a:documentation: (other languages) one or more codes identifying any other languages used in the bibliographic work.

rng:choice.rng:value: teils parallel, teils quer zur Faser
